title: A Survey of Deep Learning Models for Structural Code Understanding
abstract:
Abstract.
In recent years, the rise of deep learning and automation requirements in the software industry has elevated Intelligent Software Engineering to new heights. The number of approaches and applications in code understanding is growing, with deep learning techniques being used in many of them to better capture the information in code data. In this survey, we present a comprehensive overview of the structures formed from code data. We categorize the models for understanding code in recent years into two groups: sequence-based and graph-based models, further make a summary and comparison of them111We provide a paper collection about deep learning models and datasets for structural code understanding in https://github.com/codingClaire/Structural-Code-Understanding. We also introduce metrics, datasets and the downstream tasks. Finally, we make some suggestions for future research in structural code understanding field.
